thread.title: Jurgen Klopp must admit he's not getting it right if he wants to alleviate Liverpool pressure, says Martin Keown
thread.title_full: Jurgen Klopp must admit he's not getting it right if he wants to alleviate Liverpool pressure, says Martin Keown

author: Jake Polden
title: Jurgen Klopp must admit he's not getting it right if he wants to alleviate Liverpool pressure, says Martin Keown
text:
Sport Jurgen Klopp must admit he's not getting it right if he wants to alleviate Liverpool pressure, says Martin Keown The Arsenal legend said this current Liverpool spell has been "disastrous" and the Reds are not playing with any confidence Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Martin Keown slams Jurgen Klopp Share this video   
Jurgen Klopp has to admit he is not getting it right at Liverpool if he wants to take some of the pressure off his side. 
That's the opinion of Arsenal legend Martin Keown, who called the Reds' current run "disastrous", following their defeat to Hull City. 
Liverpool have won just once in their last 10 games in all competitions, and as Keown pointed out on BT Sport, are playing with very little confidence. 
In the above video, the ex-Gunners star discusses Liverpool's current run, and suggests Klopp must accept his failures in order to relieve pressure on his squad. Jurgen Klopp's side have won one of their last 10 games in all competitions (Photo: Reuters) 
"It will in some way take the pressure off Liverpool, Jurgen Klopp will have to admit now he is just not getting it right at all," says Keown. 
"It's disastrous, they are not playing with any confidence. 
"We saw that particularly in the league cup, they were quite appalling against Southampton when the game was there to go and win, they just weren't able to do that." Martin Keown says Klopp has to admit he is not getting it right (Photo: BTSport) Liverpool were beaten 2-0 at the KCOM Stadium (Photo: PA) 
The Reds were beaten 2-0 at the KCOM Stadium on Saturday, with goals coming in either half courtesy of debutant Alfred N'Diaye and Everton loanee Oumar Niasse. 
The result has seen Liverpool fall a staggering 13 points behind Premier League leaders Chelsea, who battered Arsenal 3-1 at the Emirates Stadium on the same day.
